alert.note: Alert for Inland Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HAZARDOUS SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LAKE MOULTRIE... ...MARINERS SHOULD SEEK SAFE HARBOR... At 540 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated hazardous showers along a line extending from near Pinopolis to near Gourdin, and moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...gusty winds 30 to 40 knots. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Small, wind driven hail could damage sails, canvas and upholstery. Take down sails if possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Moultrie should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
